description:
Mixed up with another family's child as a baby, high school student Umino Nagi is finally meeting his biological parents. On the day of their meeting, he happens to encounter Amano Erika, a high school student at a prestigious and wealthy girls school. At her request, he's half-forced into pretending to be her boyfriend so she can avoid marrying her fiance....However, not only were they the babies who had been mixed up, they're also engaged to each other! The loving parents of both families officially recognize their engagement, and the couple begins living together. Nagi is in love with his classmate Segawa Hiro, and Erika is determined to rebel against her father, so the couple agree not to get involved with each other. The mixed-up and chaotic romantic comedy starts now!

(Source: Crunchyroll)

Note: The final two episodes were broadcast together as a one hour special
synonyms: รักอลวนคนสลับบ้าน

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Arranged Marriage
tags.description: Features two characters made to marry each other, usually by their family.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Inseki
tags.description: Features sexual or romantic relations among step, adopted, and other non-blood related family members.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Shrine Maiden
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a shrine maiden.

tags.name: Cohabitation
tags.description: Features two or more people who live in the same household and develop a romantic or sexual relationship.

tags.name: Cosplay
tags.description: Features dressing up as a different character or profession.

tags.name: Alternate Universe
tags.description: Features multiple alternate universes in the same series.

title.native: カッコウのいいかげん！

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yoshikawamiki)

Miki Yoshikawa is a Japanese manga artist. Her debut work was a one-shot called Glory Days in Kodansha's Magazine Special. She was previously [Hiro Mashima](https://anilist.co/staff/96882)'s assistant on Rave Master and Fairy Tail. In 2005, she released the comedy one-shot Flunk Punk Rumble in Shonen Magazine Wonder, which was later made into a short series and eventually publicized in Kodansha's Weekly Shounen Magazine from 2006–2011, with a total of 211 chapters. In 2012, she released Yamada-kun and the Seven Witches, which has to date sold over 3 million copies, and was adapted into a live-action drama series and a TV anime series. In 2015, Yoshikawa attended Anime Expo as a guest.
_Note: Not to be confused with the [mangaka](https://anilist.co/staff/256771/)._

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/haruyama_555)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/haruyama_555/)__

__Haruko Nagaya__ is a Japanese vocalist, guitarist, lyricist, composer and member of [Ryokuoushoku Shakai](https://anilist.co/staff/161875).

__[Official Site](https://www.yoshiokakiyoe.com/)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCORsEn7EYP4RedWO5CX0uOg)__ 

**Kiyoe Yoshioka** is a Japanese vocalist, and member of the music duo __[Ikimono-gakari](https://anilist.co/staff/102277)__.

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/haruyama_555)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/haruyama_555/)__

__Haruko Nagaya__ is a Japanese vocalist, guitarist, lyricist, composer and member of [Ryokuoushoku Shakai](https://anilist.co/staff/161875).

[Official Site](https://www.phantasia.jp/) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/3pasiofficial/) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/5WmX340gDNLIAyUcg4MzWN) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/3_phantasia) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC4lk0Ob-F3ptOQUUq8s0pzQ)

Sangatsu no Phantasia is a Japanese music unit which is signed to Sacra Music. It consists of vocalist [Mia](https://anilist.co/staff/272155/Mia), whose music videos and promotional images are illustrated by various artists. The unit began activities in 2015 when it uploaded its first song "Day Break" on YouTube, before making its major debut in 2016. In addition to producing music, Mia also writes novels, with some of the unit's songs being based on her novels.

**Members:** 

- Vocals: [Mia](https://anilist.co/staff/272155/Mia)
- Composer: [Scop](https://twitter.com/scopscop)
- Illustrator: [Natsu Asami](https://twitter.com/72desuyo)
- Composer: [n-buna](https://twitter.com/nabuna2)
- Composer: [Yuuyu](https://twitter.com/yuuyu_ssry)
- Composer: [40mp](https://twitter.com/40mP)
- Composer: [buzz-G](https://twitter.com/buzz_g)
